prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with flat top and bottom surfaces. The height is approximately twice the width. The length of the shorter side is about half the length of the longer side. 1. Create a new coordinate system at the origin with 0 degrees rotation and zero translation. 2. Proceed to create a 2D sketch on the XY plane. - Sketch a rectangle with the following lines: - Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.75, 0) - Line 2: (0.75, 0) to (0.75, 0.5625) - Line 3: (0.75, 0.5625) to (0, 0.5625) - Line 4: (0, 0.5625) to (0, 0) 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D by using the Euler angles (0, 0, 0) and zero translation vector. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.1875 units, creating a solid body. Part 2: Sloped-Side Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, but with the front face angled at 45 degrees from the top and bottom faces. The side faces are parallel and perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. 1. Create a new coordinate system at the origin using the translate vector (0, 0, 0.1875). The rotations remain at (0, 0, 0). 2. Create a 2D sketch on a plane parallel to the XZ plane, displaced by 0.1875 units along the +Z direction. - Sketch a rectangle with four lines: - Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.0937, 0) - Line 2: (0.0937, 0) to (0.4688, 0.5625) - Line 3: (0.4688, 0.5625) to (0, 0.5625) - Line 4: (0, 0.5625) to (0, 0) 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.5625. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the Euler angles (0, 0, 0) and zero translation vector. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.1875 units, creating a solid body. 6. Join this new body with the previously constructed part. Part 3: Tapered Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a tapered top. 1. Create a new coordinate system at the origin using the translate vector (0.5625, 0, 0.1875). The rotations remain at (0, 0, 0). 2. Create a 2D sketch on the XY plane. - Sketch a right triangle with the following lines: - Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.1875, 0) - Line 2: (0.1875, 0) to (0.1875, 0.2812) - Line 3: (0.1875, 0.2812) to (0, 0) 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.2812. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the Euler angles (0, 0, 0) and zero translation vector. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.1875 units, creating a solid body. 6. Join this new body with the previously constructed part.</description>
